#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk authconfig
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: authconfig bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The authconfig packages contain a command-line utility and a GUI application that enable the user to configure system authentication resources. For example, authconfig can configure the system to be a client for certain network user information and authentication schemes. Notably, the bugs fixed by this update include: Previously, when the user attempted to start the authconfig utility in an environment that used a locale unknown to the system, the utility failed with the following error message: locale.Error: unsupported locale setting With this update, authconfig properly handles the exception that caused this error and uses the default locale. As a result, authconfig no longer fails in the described situation. (BZ#1187020) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The authconfig utility has been modified to configure the Pluggable Authentication Module (PAM) stack differently when support for the System Security Service Daemon (SSSD) is enabled implicitly or explicitly. Previously, only the pam_unix module was set to prompt non-local users for password, which prevented SSSD from properly prompting for two-factor authentication credentials. With this update, it is possible to update the PAM configuration with authconfig, so that only SSSD prompts non-local users for the password. This enhancement results in better user experience with SSSD two-factor authentication. (BZ#1204864) Users of authconfig are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
